text: A. K. Montgomery (c. 1903 – April 21, 1987) was a prominent New Mexico lawyer and politician who founded a prominent law firm in the state and served in the New Mexico Senate."Montgomery, A.K.", The Santa Fe New Mexican (April 24, 1987), p. A-8. Born in Emory, Texas, Montgomery moved to New Mexico after World War I. He received a law degree from Cumberland School of Law, then in Tennessee, in 1927, and gained admission to the bar in New Mexico in 1931. With J.O. Seth as his law partner, Montgomery founded the prominent Santa Fe law firm of Seth & Montgomery in 1937. Montgomery was elected to represent Santa Fe County in the New Mexico Senate from 1937 to 1941, and was an unsuccessful Democratic candidate for Lieutenant Governor in 1942."Anderson Likes No Candidates In N.M. Race", El Paso Times (August 1, 1942), p. 10. He later served as Chairman of the State Prison Board in the 1960s.Fred Buckles, "Easy Passage Seen For Election Bill", Las Cruces Sun-News (February 12, 1967), p. 4. He was on the board of directors of the Santa Fe National Bank from 1962 to 1972. His son, Seth D. Montgomery, became a Justice of the New Mexico Supreme Court.The Santa Fe New Mexican (December 8, 1994), p. 4. Montgomery retired to Albuquerque in 1983, and died there four years later, from kidney disease. ==References== Category:1900s births Category:1987 deaths Category:People from Rains County, Texas Category:Cumberland School of Law alumni Category:New Mexico state senators
